title: Has the iPhone been the most significant invention in the last twenty years? - Quora

response.answer_text: No! Not even close. There is nothing inherently unique about the iPhone itself. It is a cellular phone combined with a touchscreen tablet. None of which is technology that was created by Apple. The iPhone is well blended design of other technologies. It is not unique. Since it is not unique it can not be the most significant anything in the last 20 years.

The category is So broad, it is hard to pick “The” most significant. But having access to the sum of all human knowledge in one’s pocket is almost immeasurably powerful. And it’s really just getting going. That little handheld device will synergize with 5G and Starlink™ which will enable people almost anywhere on the planet to connect to the Internet using a small solar cell and an antenna. And anytime 24/7 if they have a modest battery /charger setup.
